An efficient isogeometric Galerkin method for IEVP
  • Roadmap
  • Timeline

    • IGA package
An efficient isogeometric Galerkin method for IEVP
  • »
  • Documentation
  • View page source

Documentation¶

This documentation covers the implementation of the new Galerkin method. Examples for each module can be found in the source code in the main section of the respective module. To gain an overview over the code base reference the Index.

IGA package¶

Computes the span index in , in which lies

Parameters

  • u (float) – evaluation point

  • p (int) – basis function degree

  • U (np.array(float)) – knot vector

Returns

span index

Return type

int

tensiga.iga.bfunsop.bfunsop(u, p, U)¶

Computes values, rows and cols for an operator (a sparse matrix) of the form

For perfomance and flexibility reasons the sparse matrix is to be constructed out of the return values, e.g. scipy.sparse.csc_matrix(vals, rows, cols)

Parameters

  • u (np.array(float)) – evaluation point(s)

  • p (int) – basis function degree

  • U (np.array(float)) – knot vector

Returns

(values, (rows, cols))

Return type

(float, (float, float))

tensiga.iga.bfunsop.bfunsmat(u, p, U)¶

Computes a matrix of the form , where and for each th column the row of the matrix corresponds to the value of th bspline basis function at .

Parameters

  • u (np.array(float)) – evaluation point(s)

  • p (int) – basis function degree

  • U (np.array(float)) – knot vector

Returns

matrix

Return type

np.array(float)

  • n (in) – highest derivative order

tensiga.iga.dbfunsop.dbfunsop(i, n, u, p, U)¶

Computes values, rows and cols for an operator (a sparse matrix) of the form

For perfomance and flexibility reasons the sparse matrix is to be constructed out of the return values, e.g. scipy.sparse.csc_matrix(vals, rows, cols)

Parameters

  • n (int) – derivative order

  • u (np.array(float)) – evaluation point(s)

  • p (int) – basis function degree

  • U (np.array(float)) – knot vector

Returns

(values, (rows, cols))

Return type

(float, (int, int))

tensiga.iga.kntinsop.kntinsop(i, n, u, p, U)¶

Computes the single knot insertion operator in the form of a sparse matrix. The knot vector remains unchanged!

The operation is to be evalated as

Parameters

  • i (int) – knot span in which lies

  • n (int) – number of basis functions defined on the knot vector

  • u (float) – evaluation point

  • p (int) – basis degree

  • U (np.array(float)) – knot vector

Returns

(values, (rows, cols))

Return type

(float, (int, int))

tensiga.iga.ktsinsop.ktsinsop(n, u, p, U)¶

Computes the multi-knot insertion operator in the form of a sparse matrix, which is returned together with the new knot vector.

The operation is to be evalated as

Parameters

  • n (int) – number of basis functions defined on the knot vector

  • u (np.array(float)) – evaluation points

  • p (int) – basis degree

  • U (np.array(float)) – knot vector

Returns

operator np.array(float) : updated knot vector

Return type

scipy.sparse.csc_matrix()

class tensiga.iga.Bspline.Bspline(dim, codim, kv, deg, ctrlpts)¶

A data container for a Bspline geometric object and an interface to applicable geometric modules.

dim¶

dimension of the Bspline object

Type

int

codim¶

dimension of the embedding space

Type

int

kv¶

list of knot vectors in each parametric direction

Type

list(np.array)

deg¶

list of degrees for each parametric direction

Type

list(int)

ctrlpts¶

list of control point coordinates for each coordinate in the embedding space

Type

list(np.array)

nbfuns¶

number of basis functions in each direction

Type

np.array(int)

elsz()¶

Computes the element sizes in the physical space. Element size is defined as the length of the element diagonal.

Returns

element sizes

Return type

array(float)

eval(u, k=0)¶

Evaluates the Bspline in the physical space in direction k.

Parameters

u (List(np.array(float))) – list of evaluation points in each parametric direction

Returns

coordinates at each grid point in physical direction k.

Return type

np.array(float)

evalwrt(u, P)¶

Evaluates the Bspline with respect to a set of control points P.

Parameters

  • u (List(np.array(float))) – list of evaluation points in each parametric direction

  • P (np.array(float)) – control points

Returns

coordinates at each grid point in physical direction k.

Return type

np.array(float)

nelem(k=None)¶

Computes the number of elements. If k = None compute total number of elements. For k=1,...,dim computes the univariate elements in the direction k.

Parameters

k (int) – parametric direction

Returns

number of elements

Return type

int
